content:
PickBranch Class

In this Article

A potential path of execution within a Pick activity.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("Action")]
public sealed class PickBranch

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • PickBranch

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

A PickBranch contains a Trigger and an Action. At the beginning of a Pick elementâ€™s execution, all the trigger activities from all PickBranch elements are scheduled. When the first (leftmost) activity completes, the corresponding action activity is scheduled, and all other trigger activities are canceled.

Constructors summary

PickBranch()

Creates a new instance of the PickBranch activity.

Properties summary

Action

The Activity to execute if this branch is triggered for execution.
DisplayName

The name of this branch to be displayed in the activity designer.
Trigger

The activity whose completion activates this pick branch.
Variables

The collection of user-defined variables associated with this activity.

Constructors

  • PickBranch()

    Creates a new instance of the PickBranch activity.

    public PickBranch ();

    Example

    The following code sample demonstrates creating a PickBranch activity. This example is from the Using the Pick Activity sample. 

    static Activity CreateWF()
{
    Variable<string> name = new Variable<string>();
    Sequence body = new Sequence
    {
        Variables = { name },
        Activities = 
        {
            new WriteLine { Text = "What is your name? (You have 5 seconds to answer)" },
            new Pick
            {
               Branches = 
               {
                   new PickBranch
                    {
                       Trigger = new ReadString
                       {
                           Result = name,
                           BookmarkName = bookmarkName
                       },
                       Action = new WriteLine 
                       { 
                           Text = new InArgument<string>(env => "Hello " + name.Get(env)) 
                       }
                   },
                   new PickBranch
                    {
                       Trigger = new Delay
                       {
                           Duration = TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)
                       },
                       Action = new WriteLine
                       {
                           Text = "Time is up."
                       }
                   }
               }
           }
       }
    };

    return body;
}

Properties

  • Action

    The Activity to execute if this branch is triggered for execution.

    public System.Activities.Activity Action { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Activity

      The activity to execute.

    Example

    The following code sample demonstrates setting the Action property of a PickBranch activity. This example is from the Using the Pick Activity sample. 

    static Activity CreateWF()
{
    Variable<string> name = new Variable<string>();
    Sequence body = new Sequence
    {
        Variables = { name },
        Activities = 
        {
            new WriteLine { Text = "What is your name? (You have 5 seconds to answer)" },
            new Pick
            {
               Branches = 
               {
                   new PickBranch
                    {
                       Trigger = new ReadString
                       {
                           Result = name,
                           BookmarkName = bookmarkName
                       },
                       Action = new WriteLine 
                       { 
                           Text = new InArgument<string>(env => "Hello " + name.Get(env)) 
                       }
                   },
                   new PickBranch
                    {
                       Trigger = new Delay
                       {
                           Duration = TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)
                       },
                       Action = new WriteLine
                       {
                           Text = "Time is up."
                       }
                   }
               }
           }
       }
    };

    return body;
}
  • DisplayName

    The name of this branch to be displayed in the activity designer.

    public string DisplayName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The branch name.

  • Trigger

    The activity whose completion activates this pick branch.

    public System.Activities.Activity Trigger { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Activity

      The triggering activity.

    Example

    The following code sample demonstrates setting the Trigger property of a PickBranch activity. This example is from the Using the Pick Activity sample. 

    static Activity CreateWF()
{
    Variable<string> name = new Variable<string>();
    Sequence body = new Sequence
    {
        Variables = { name },
        Activities = 
        {
            new WriteLine { Text = "What is your name? (You have 5 seconds to answer)" },
            new Pick
            {
               Branches = 
               {
                   new PickBranch
                    {
                       Trigger = new ReadString
                       {
                           Result = name,
                           BookmarkName = bookmarkName
                       },
                       Action = new WriteLine 
                       { 
                           Text = new InArgument<string>(env => "Hello " + name.Get(env)) 
                       }
                   },
                   new PickBranch
                    {
                       Trigger = new Delay
                       {
                           Duration = TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)
                       },
                       Action = new WriteLine
                       {
                           Text = "Time is up."
                       }
                   }
               }
           }
       }
    };

    return body;
}

    The collection of user-defined variables associated with this activity.
